job_description:
• Associate's degree in Mechatronics, Electronics, Mechanical Engineering, or a related technical field or equivalent experience.
• Hands-on experience with tools, machinery, or basic equipment maintenance (through school, work, or military).
• Willingness to follow safety procedures and wear personal protective equipment (PPE) when required.
• Use basic mechanical, electronic, and computer skills to assist with trouble-shooting and repairs.
• Participate in training and development programs to build technical and professional skills.
• Basic mechanical or electrical proficiency and interest in learning technical skills.
• Strong communication skills and ability to work well in a team environment.
• Ability to work 12-hour shifts (3 on/4 off and 4 on/3 off), including standing for long periods and lifting equipment.

documentation skills and ability to write procedures and reports Desire to be part of a rapidly evolving organization and taking products and processes to the next level Ability to lift up to 15 pounds and potentially stand or sit for up to 3 hour increments Experience in automation and packaging of Life Science products, Food Packaging products or related field preferred Relevant experience in a production environment working with standard production control tools – ERP, inventory control, and work orders Experience training employees on production processes defined in production batch
